Bringing a newbie into OO
=3D=3D=3D=3D=3D=
=3D=3D=3D=3D=3D=3D=3D=3D=3D=3D=3D=3D=3D=3D=3D=3D=3D=3D=3D=3D

I would like =
to ask the people on this list for recommendations of the best
literature t=
o bring an OO newbie up to speed.

The programming language in question is =
Java, which means that there is a
splendid wealth of online material for so=
meone to learn the language.  The
important thing, however, is to instill t=
he notion of OO purity, which is
harder, perhaps, than just teaching the la=
nguage.

For example: the GoF patterns book is a must, but I think it is no=
t a text
that you can give to someone until they have a grounding in OO tec=
hniques.

Your thoughts?

Manuel Amago.
